item.title: Report X-2023041016
item.description:
Report X-2023041016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-09T18:11:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-18
  • City: LOGAN
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND UNDAMAGED IN TRAILER. PACKAGE HANDLER WAS IN THE PROCESS OF REMOVING IT FROM THE SORT, TO CART TO WORK AREA, WHEN HE ACCIDENTALLY PUNCTURED THE SIDE ON A METAL PART OF CONVEYOR. MANAGEMENT/CERTIFIED ADMIN WERE INFORMED OF SITUATION, AQUIRED SDS, AND BEGAN CLEAN UP PROCESS. DescribePack: CRACK WAS ON THE LOWER PORTION OF THE CYLINDER BUCKET; CRACK WAS ABOUT 2-3 IN BIG. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UNLOAD WAS STOPPED ON THAT DOOR. ADMIN AND MANAGEMENT AQUIRED HAZMAT CLEAN UP MATERIALS AND PLACED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE INTO A HAZMAT BAG AND BIN, TO SEPARATE IT FROM THE SORT. ALL CLEAN UP ITEMS WERE THEN COLLECTED AND STORED WITH DAMAGED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report E-2023040428
item.description:
Report E-2023040428

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-09T18:11:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 6, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of paint to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted surface. ER personnel placed the two (2) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all paint impacted material in the same 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE BLOCK OF DRY ICE COOLING FROZEN STRAWBERRIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED AS EVENTFUL SWEETS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023031160
item.description:
Report X-2023031160

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-20
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 03/20/2033 at approximately 1602, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved notification from Employee 3633256 at the sorting facility in Salt Lake City, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The package contained an electric skateboard and is classified as UN 3171 battery-powered vehicles, under Special Provisions A214. The package was transported to the facility without the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork as per the IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2023010123
item.description:
Report I-2023010123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-16
  • City: WEST VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SINCLAIR TRUCKING COMPANY LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: THE SINCLAIR TRUCK DRIVER WAS PROCEEDING SOUTH ON THE MOUNTAIN VIEW CORRIDOR. WHEN THE TRUCK AN DRIVER ARRIVED AT 3500 SOUTH, THE LIGHT WAS GREEN FOR THE SINCLAIR TRUCK TO PROCEED THROUGHT THE INTERSECTION. A SUV (SMALL JEEP), MADE A LEFT-HAND TURN FROM THE NORTHBOUND LANE DURING A RED LIGHT FOR THE TURN LANE AND WAS STRUCK BY THE SINCLAIR TRUCK. THE TRUCK WAS FORCED TO ITS RIGHT, ROLLED, AND HIT A CONCRETE WALL. THE TRACTOR IMPACTED THE CONCRETE WALL AND THE DRIVER WAS KILLED WHEN THE TRUCK IMPACTED THE WALL. THE FRONT OF THE TRAILER WAS CRUSHED AND A HOLE WAS TORN IN THE SIDE OF THE TRAILER BY THE CONCRETE WALL. WHEN THE TRAILER ROLLED THE CONCUSSION OF HITTING THE CONCRETE AND THE SCRAPING AS IT CONTINUED DOWN ROAD OPENED UP MANY SMALLER HOLES IN THE SIDE OF THE TANK AND IT LEAKED. WEST VALLEY FIRE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED AND FIRST ATTENDANT TO THE DRIVER AND CONFIRMED THAT THE DRIVER HAD NOT SURVIVED THE CRASH. THE WVC FIRE DEPARTMENT THEN TENDED TO CONTROLLING THE FLOW OF THE DIESEL TO TRY AND AVOID STORM DRAINS AND DIRT AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE BY KEEPING THE DIESEL UP ON THE CONCRETE. AN AMOUNT OF DIESEL DID GO INTO THE STORM DRAIN AND FOLLOWED THE DRAIN FOR ABOUT A QUARTER OF A MILE. SINCLAIR TRUCKING CALLED IN ENVIROCARE TO DO THE CLEANUP. ENVIROCARE IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWED THE DIESEL IN THE STORM DRAIN UNTIL THEY GOT TO RETENTION AREA, AND THEY SET UP ABSORBENT BOOMS AND BUILT DAMS FROM SOIL TO STOP THE PROGRESS OF THE DIESEL. THE CITY OF WEST VALLEY BROUGHT IN LOADS OF DIRT ALONG WITH THE UTAH DOT AND USED IT TO DAM UP AND CONTROL THE FLOW.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1206 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USU. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN1823,8,II Caustic Soda was released from a 50-pound paper bag due to unknown reasons. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released to the dock floor from two damaged bags due to a puncture. The damaged bags and released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal USU contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning an approximate 20-gallon spill of UN1987 "SDA 3C 190 Proof" that was released from a 55-gallon poly drum after being punctured by a forklift. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and advised there were no visible signs of any released material. Anything released had evaporated. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2022110570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0747 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (USU) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 30 gallons of ULTRA 1030 (#1226) - (Hazardous - UN3266) was released. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to an 8' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 6' area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to being crushed by other freight. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0921 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USU. It was reported that approximately 8 ounces of Nitro Ecocell 1/2 ES were released from a 220.5-lb cardboard drum due to the drum falling over and being punctured by other freight during transit. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3153043. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1130 ET, EnviroServe personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The damaged drum and released product were containerized into an 85-gallon poly drum and submerged in water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On September 6, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ethanol and methanol (contains UN1993) was damaged during loading and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ER personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized the damaged drum and all ethanol and methanol-impacted material into two (2) 95-gallon drums and one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2022100147
item.description:
Report I-2022100147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-11
  • City: Springville
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: JPS LOGISTICS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was at truck stop and noticed Ieakage from rear of trailer. He called his dispatcher and my company, Environmental Management, Inc.(EMI) was contacted to provide a response. I called Graymar Environmental(GE) and requested a crew respond. Upon arrival, GE made entry into the enclosed trailer and observe one(1) 275-gallon tote was on its side. The tote was in the second row from the rear. There was a total of 16 totes on the load. GE observed the totes in the front had shifted forward and allowed this tote to fall over on its side. There was a bladder inside the outside plastic walls which had burst down one side because of the impact when it fell over. GE removed all the 16 totes, wiped them down, and cleaned the trailer as much as possible. JPS arranged to have a second trailer brought to the site and GE loaded the 15 undamaged totes onto this trailer. GE removed the damaged tote and all other cleanup debris and transported it to their terminal. Estimated time of the release was 3-4 hours. GE was at the site for at least 24 hours monitoring the area after the cleanup was complete and the second trailer was obtained to load the undamaged totes.

  • City: SALT LAKE CTY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1000 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (USU) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture UN1760 Lo-pHoam released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer at dock door #67. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe for cleanup and containment. At 1050 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons of product released to an 8' x 20' area of the trailer floor and 10 gallons of product released to a 10' x 8' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. All waste was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

THE TOP OF PAINT CAN TYPE OF CONTAINER HAD BLACK CLIPS TO HELP SEAL THE CONTAINER, 2 OF 4 CLIPS WERE IN THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. AND THE OTHER 2 CLIPS WERE CLOSE TOGETHER ON ONE SIDE OF THE CAN/LID THEREFORE NOT PREVENTING THE LID FROM POPPING OPEN ON THE SIDE CONTAINING NO CLIPS. PROCESSED THE CONTENTS AS A HAZMAT WITH A GREEN BAG QND SEALED INSIDE A BUCKET.

item.title: Report E-2022070295
item.description:
Report E-2022070295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-06
  • City: TOOELE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/20/2022, the covered hopper railcar was loaded in Cheyenne, WY with 220,100 lbs. of ammonium nitrate fertilizer (AN). The railcar departed Cheyenne on 6/21/2022 and was delivered to industry at Tooele, UT site on 6/28/2022. The railcar was transported by the Union Pacific Railroad (UP) from Cheyenne, WY to Tooele, UT and made five stops for transfer to other trains over the eight-day journey. The car remained at the Rocky Mountain Rail Repair rail siting until 7/6//2022, when it was moved to the Savage Services transloading site for offloading. Savage Services noted that all seals were present with the exception of the one for the center bottom gate. The Savage employees noted a steel cable was clipped to the hasp instead of a seal. Savage employees did not inspect further and began offloading the AN. The Savage employees subsequently discovered the railcar was missing 40,581 lbs. of AN and notified Dyno Nobel. Dyno Nobel notified FRA inspector Jerome Sedillo who advised to notify the NRC. Dyno Nobel notified the Savage Services Ops Manager that he needed to report the incident to the NRC since he was in possession of the railcar and its material. Dyno Nobel contacted the UP and advised them of the incident to inspect their railyards and tracks for evidence of AN. On 7/7/2022, Dyno Nobel was informed that Savage Services did not make the report, so Dyno Nobel contacted the NRC. Savage, Rocky Mountain, and the UP did not locate evidence of AN in their railyards or along the tracks. The Cheyenne loading site also inspected their site and did not find evidence of AN on the tracks. On 7/10/2022, Rocky Mountain inspected the railcar and found the center gravity gate had a worn-out drive bar, and the pinion was not engaging the door rack. The inspector stated this will allow the door to move easily and would not permit it to completely close when loaded. During transit, it appears the bottom gate opened and spilled AN, which dispersed along the route within the railroad tracks. It also appears someone may have discovered it and attempted to secure the gate using the steel cable, but no one reported it. In the event the UP locates AN prill along the rail line or in any of the UP yards, Dyno Nobel will coordinate with them to recover and clean up the prill by hiring a hazardous materials contractor. Dyno Nobel inspected their loading site, interviewed the railcar loaders and track crew, and reviewed the loading procedures with those employees. See attached documents for the detailed timeline of the incident, the railcar inspection report, and the shipping papers. There are two areas in this report, which require additional explanation. One area is the validation message that states: Questions #3 and #7 - The Incident Date and Location do not match the date and location in the master NRC database for NRC number: 1340861. Please check the NRC Number to ensure it is valid and the Incident Date and Location in Questions 3 an

item.title: Report I-2022080027
item.description:
Report I-2022080027

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-08
  • City: Salt Lake City
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS RAMP IN SALT LAKE CITY, UT A FEDEX PAK WAS OBSERVED LEAKING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE PAK CONTAINED MARYKATE ON AND OFF HULL BOTTOM CLEANER, WHICH PER THE ASSOCIATED SDS IS FULLY REGULATED AS UN1760 CORROSIVE LIQUID, NOS CONTAINS HYDROCHLORIC PHOSPHORIC ACIDS PG II. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE PACKAGING, AND NO SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS WAS OFFERED WITH THE SHIPMENT. FOLLOWING SPILL CLEANUP, THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELP PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded and placed onto a cart. It was observed that the can was leaking a liquid slowly. The package was isolated in a red hazmat tote with a hazmat liner and lid upon discovery. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered that the bottom of the can was dented and the contents were leaking slowly through the seam. item.title: Report X-2022060538
item.description:
Report X-2022060538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-08T21:08:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-17
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT WAS DISCOVERED WHILE DOOR 32 WAS BEING UNLOADED. HAZMAT WAS PLACED TO THE SIDE WHILE TRAILER WAS CLEANED OUT. A SEPARATE LEAKER WAS FOUND AND ALSO PUT TO THE SIDE UNTIL TRAILER WAS EMPTY. NON-HAZMAT LEAKER WAS REPORTED TO RESPONDERS. DESIGNATED RESPONDER CAME AND FOUND BOTH LEAKERS. DIDN'T HAVE ROOM ON CART AND DIDN'T WANT TO MIX HAZMAT AND NON-HAZMAT, SO RESPONDER QUICKLY PUT NON-HAZMAT AWAY AND THEN EQUIPPED PROPPER PPE TO RESPOND TO HAZMAT. RESPONDER TOOK HAZMAT BACK TO CLERKS TO BE PROCESSED.
